results.title: Tit for tat [Censored version]
results.creator_credit: Graeme Isaac, Mayfan and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Examines the world of tattoos and the surrounding culture of bikers and rebels as the filmmaker travels with Baldy, a biker and photo-journalist, to the Sandhurst Rally for the yearly Tattoo Exhibition and judging. There they meet AJ, the most tattooed man in Australia and a renowned tattoo artist himself. WARNING - SOME SCENES IN THIS PROGRAMME MAY OFFEND SOME VIEWERS.

results.title: Exile and the kingdom (A)
results.creator_credit: Frank Rijavec, Noelene Harrison and Ngurin Aboriginal Corporation
results.brief_description: Roger Solomon, an Aboriginal from the north of Western Australia, narrates this history of the tribes from the Fortescue River area, who have been forced into coastal ghettoes, specifically in Roebourne, as a result of government policies, lack of work and the encroachment of mining interests. This removal from their tribal lands has led to their current problems which Solomon and the elders of the tribe would like to solve by a return to their homelands and tribal law. The video is in two parts.

results.title: The Pacific century
results.creator_credit: Marc Levin, Al Levin, Teleac Holland, Nihon Hoso Kyokai, KCTS (Television station : Seattle, Wash.), Jigsaw Productions and PBI Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 10 of Series “The Pacific century”.
The final program in the series looks at America’s future as a “Pacific nation” by charting current economic and political trends, including the flood of Asian investment in the U.S., the domination of Asian technology and the rapid growth of Asian immigration. Through portraits of politicians, business leaders and working men and women “The Pacific century” will confront the economic, political and cultural challenges that will determine America’s future in this region to which it is inextricably connected.

results.title: The Fight for democracy
results.creator_credit: Carl Byker, Teleac Holland, Nihon Hoso Kyokai, Jigsaw Productions and PBI Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 8 of Series “The Pacific century”.
This program uses the recent history of South Korea to look at the way economic success in South East Asia is leading to greater democracy. A union member, a journalist, a women’s rights activist and a successful businessman are four characters in a powerful, emotional story of people demanding a greater stake and a say in the way their nation is run. A study guide and faculty manual are available to accompany this series.

results.title: Reinventing Japan
results.creator_credit: Alex Gibney, Teleac Holland, KCTS (Television station : Seattle, Wash.), Nihon Hoso Kyokai, Jigsaw Productions and PBI Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “The Pacific century”.
This program looks at the peculiar relationship between Japan and the United States that emerged in the wake of World War II. Set to the tunes of big band jazz and including footage of the period never before seen, “Reinventing Japan” captures the spirit of a strange era, full of idealism and democracy as well as bitter betrayals, when one country tried to reinvent another in its image - with surprising and unexpected results.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Alex Gibney, Teleac Holland, KCTS (Television station : Seattle, Wash.), Nihon Hoso Kyokai, Jigsaw Productions and PBI Productions

results.title: The Killing times (A)
results.brief_description: In August 1928, in the desert of Central Australia, seven white Australians murdered seventeen members of the Walbiri tribe. The Coniston Massacre, as it became known, was the last large-scale massacre of Aborigines in Australia. This video dramatises the massacre and the subsequent Federal Inquiry, as well as the eventual victory of the Walbiri for the right to return and live where they were born. The cast includes Ray Barrett, Max Gillies and Martin Vaughan. Narrated by Bob Plasto. Teacher’s notes accompany the video.

results.title: Shoalwater: up for grabs
results.creator_credit: Helen Stickley-Thompson, David Bradbury and Film Finance Corporation Australia
results.brief_description: This film is about a group of people fighting for the preservation of Shoalwater Bay (Queensland). With its sweeping bays, untouched golden beaches, its jungle and rainforest, 200 metre high sand-dunes (purported to be the oldest in the world), Shoalwater Bay is home to a multitude of birds, plants and wildlife. But this is all under threat due to both the Federal and Queensland State Governments issuing exploratory sandmining leases to several Australian and Japanese mining companies - the justification being the potential creation of jobs. However, there are many who would dispute the actual number of jobs which will become available and who argue that this unique part of Queensland’s coastline must be preserved at all costs. Produced by Award-Winning Documentary filmmaker, David Bradbury and narrated by Peter Garrett (of Midnight Oil fame).

results.title: Thailand
results.creator_credit: David Roberts, Richard Carey, Nihon Hoso Kyokai, Maryland Public Television and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Mini dragons. II”.
In Thailand sudden economic success has created violence in the streets as a prosperous new middle-class demands democratic reform. Success, however, comes at a heavy price - pollution, an ever-increasing gap between rich and poor, uncontrolled development and destruction of the rainforest. Interviews four individuals who represent different aspects of Thailand’s success. A young ethnic Chinese millionairess who builds shopping malls, the Governor of the city of Bangkok, who is trying to solve its horrendous overcrowding problems, a couple of rural peasants forced to work in Bangkok to provide for their son’s education and an activist Buddhist monk trying to save the rainforest.

results.title: Malaysia
results.creator_credit: Tom Hurwitz, Maria Nicolo, Nihon Hoso Kyokai, Maryland Public Television and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Mini dragons. II”.
Since the British withdrew from Malaysia in the 50’s Malaysia has developed dramatically in an economic sense. Now the government has a thirty year plan, Vision 2020, which seeks to accelerate this development in favour of the native Malays rather than the successful Chinese. The program looks at individuals and their particular problems: a Chinese business man, who is attempting to set up a multi-racial business school, a rubber and oil palm plantation manager who faces the loss of his workforce to the cities, a tribal community who face government takeover of their land, and a young Moslem woman who is attempting to protect from exploitation the young girls recruited from villages to work in the city factories.

results.title: Kangaroos: faces in the mob
results.creator_credit: Glen Carruthers, Jan Aldenhoven and Green Cape Wildlife Films
results.brief_description: Award-winning filmmakers, Dr. Jan Aldenhoven and Glen Carruthers, spent two years working with a team of biologists to produce this engaging and stunningly photographed study of the lives of a mob of 60 Eastern Grey kangaroos in a NSW river valley. The biologists had been studying this mob continuously for fifteen years. Their studies have revealed the richly complex society of the mob. In the course of the year, we see everything from birth to the dramatic and sometimes deadly contests between the males. Winner of a Logie award for best documentary.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Glen Carruthers, Jan Aldenhoven and Green Cape Wildlife Films
